body_html:
@andrewharp - Thanks for the tips. I can build it using the command line above.

I replicated the switch in srcs from android_tensorflow_lib_lite and that also prevented the errors I was seeing while building correctly for android when I asked for that. I can raise a PR for that if you want / haven't already?

While this change makes it better, it might be more intuitive for users (like me) if this target failed to build with a message saying it should be built with android tools explicitly. Does it makes sense to build android_tensorflow_lib for anything except an android target? Then again I'm only new to bazel so it may well be just right as it is given the trade-off between build system complexity and user-friendliness.

Btw. I didn't have a problem building an app for Android using the docs and the android/BUILD example. I came across this error when trying to understand what steps bazel was doing internally in the android_binary command, just for curiosity's sake really.

I'm happy to close the PR if we can replace it with another as suggested by @andrewharp.

@andrewharp - Thanks for the tips. I can build it using the command line above.

While this change makes it better, it might be more intuitive for users (like me) if this target failed to build with a message saying it should be built with android tools explicitly. Does it makes sense to build android_tensorflow_lib for anything except an android target? Then again I'm only new to bazel so it may well be just right as it is given the trade-off between build system complexity and user-friendliness.
Btw. I didn't have a problem building an app for Android using the docs and the android/BUILD example. I came across this error when trying to understand what steps bazel was doing internally in the android_binary command, just for curiosity's sake really.
I'm happy to close the PR if we can replace it with another as suggested by @andrewharp.
body:
@andrewharp - Thanks for the tips. I can build it using the command line above.

I replicated the switch in `srcs` from `android_tensorflow_lib_lite` and that also prevented the errors I was seeing while building correctly for android when I asked for that. I can raise a PR for that if you want / haven't already?

While this change makes it better, it might be more intuitive for users (like me) if this target failed to build with a message saying it should be built with android tools explicitly. Does it makes sense to build `android_tensorflow_lib` for anything except an android target? Then again I'm only new to bazel so it may well be just right as it is given the trade-off between build system complexity and user-friendliness.

Btw. I didn't have a problem building an app for Android using [the docs](http://bazel.io/docs/tutorial/android-app.html) and the `android/BUILD` example. I came across this error when trying to understand what steps bazel was doing internally in the `android_binary` command, just for curiosity's sake really.

I'm happy to close the PR if we can replace it with another as suggested by @andrewharp.
